alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:47PM EST until further notice by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River Above Singac affecting Morris, Essex and Passaic Counties. For the Passaic River...including Chatham, Little Falls, Millington, Pine Brook, Singac...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River above Singac. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Portions of the Wayne Town Center parking lot begin to flood. Hobson Avenue and Riverlawn Drive in Wayne begin to flood. Fairfield Road, Fayette Avenue, and Riversedge Road in Wayne can flood as water backs up the Pompton River. Lincoln Boulevard in Lincoln Park can also flood due to backwater up the Pompton river. The Pequannock River Park also floods. At 9.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield is subject to closures. At 9.5 feet, Camp Lane and Marginal Road in Fairfield begins to flood. At 10.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield begins to flood. Finns Drive, Siesta Drive, and Market street in Wayne are all susceptible to flooding. William Street, Louis Street, and Zeliff Avenue in Little Falls can begin to flood. Portions of Lincoln Park become impassable. The Meadows Golf Club in Lincoln Park floods. At 11.0 feet, Little Falls Road in Fairfield floods. Flooding increases across the Singac section of Little Falls. At 12.0 feet, Willowbrook Boulevard begins to flood. The Route 46 ramp to access the Willowbrook Mall can flood as the Naachtpunkt Brook backs up. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.1 feet. - The river rose above flood stage late Wednesday morning, and has steadily risen above moderate flood stage to 10.1 feet this evening. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.6 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall to 10.9 feet and begin rising again Friday evening. It will rise to 11.0 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 09/03/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Passaic River Singac 8.5 10.1 Wed 8 pm 11.6 10.9 11.6 1pm 1/11 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1000 AM EST.
